reviews.review_text: One of the best restaurant in Metro Vancouver! I highly recommend the 7 course menu and their cocktails. DJ was really attentive and really nice to us throughout our dinner. Nice meeting you DJ! Hope to see you again soon. Thank you for your lovely service. Well definitely come back
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind feedback, we look forward to having you back soon

reviews.review_text: Torafuku in Vancouver offers an inviting culinary journey that seamlessly combines Asian influences with a modern flair. Celebrating its 8th anniversary with a reinvigorated spirit after a restoration, the restaurant presents an enticing fall menu ranging from light salads to robust main courses like the black cod bouillabaisse. The standout Beef Noodle Soup, noted for its melt-in-your-mouth quality, exemplifies their commitment to flavor. The Chicken & Crack Rice is another testament to the kitchens prowess, offering comfort with a touch of sophistication. Despite its popularity, the restaurant maintains an efficient service, with quick seating and fast, friendly staff, even on a Sunday - which seems like the ideal time to go if you dont want to wait. The dining experience is enhanced by the ambience, characterized by an understated room with an open kitchen and industrial touches, complemented by a communal table for those who enjoy a convivial atmosphere. The versatility of the menu caters to different palates, with lunchtime focusing on quick, rice bowl options and dinner revealing more adventurous dishes with European influences. With thoughtful services like air conditioning and card payment options, the restaurant ensures a comfortable visit for its guests. Operating hours accommodate a range of dining preferences, making it an ideal spot for both early and late meals. Torafuku stands out as a must-visit for its quality dishes, recognized by culinary experts and patrons alike, providing a rich dining experience in the heart of Vancouver.

We came here on a recommendation from a friend and was amazed at how fantastic every single dish was.  Wish we could have tried more but we were so full.  We went with ala carte because there were assume options that were not available thru the tasting menu and it didnt disappoint. Definitely order their signature dish Kanpachi Crudo if you want one of the most unbelievable dishes to that weve ever had.  We also ordered the burrata, chicken wings, bison tartare, beef ribs and duck breast followed by cheese cake for dessert. Everything was amazing and well definitely be back. Staff were also knowledgeable, fantastic, friendly and extremely efficient.

Place was great. Food was beyond fantastic and all the staff we interacted with were wonderful. My only subtracting option is that they were not flexible in their menu. For example we knew they did a to die for chicken fat rice, but when asked apparently it is only for the lunch menu. Still a fantastic experience would recommend.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Chris for your kind words!  We do offer 2 completely different menus for lunch and dinner, we hope youd come back to our lunch service to try our delicious kickass rice in the near future.  Thank you for coming in!

reviews.review_text: One of my favourite asian fusion restaurants in Vancouver! You ll find Taiwanese, Japanese and korean flavours. The food was flavourful and beautifully presented. Service was friendly and the decor was elevated and modern. Chef Steve Kuan is super talented, very deserving of his michelin recommended status 2 years in a row! Some highlights were the short rib, halibut, tartare, crudo and cheesecake! If you re around for lunch, his Taiwanese beef noodle soup is super authentic and the best i ve found in Vancouver. I will definitely be back soon!
I really enjoyed the foods and drinks. Service was amazing as well. Highly recommend!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the positive feedback! Your comment is important to us and we will keep up the good work!

reviews.review_text: This place was excellent if you want affordable fine dining. It was incredible to try all the flavors. Highly recommend the short rib and the chicken wings. Also all the desserts are fantastic but my favorite was the cheesecake. Also the cocktails are incredible!

Love this place for some innovative Asian fusion eats. Have had both their omakase menus $65 and a la carte. Most recently went with a friend and ordered 3 dishes and it was plenty. - Brussel sprouts - always a fave - mussels in miso butter cream sauce (omg wish we had bread to soak up this sauce) - risotto with  and black garlic Each time I come, they rotate some seasonal dishes while keeping some good ones.
The Beef noodle soup (served during lunch only) is what brings me back here. Really enjoy the fried chicken as well.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for loving our beef noodle soup, your feedback is important to us

reviews.review_text: Third time back and it just keeps on getting better here. Asian fusion done right with a solid cocktail menu that have a wide range for all palate. Food was on point and flavorful. Even the simplest dish of potatoes was delicious with a truffle sauce to dip. Not a great place for vegan eaters as we had one person that left a little hungry. Overall, will be again again as the menu do change often and keeps it interesting.

The food is amazing, every single bite is worth it. Super friendly service and great drink options. Highly recommend. Seating might be limited, reservations are recommended. Even with a reservation you might end up sharing a bar style table with other people.
Food are very good. Cocktails are good and unique. Food : 5/5 |
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind words, we will keep the good work

reviews.review_text: Torafukus flavor combinations are so perfectly balanced and unique, I was enthralled by every new dish that came to our table. We got the spring tasting menu with duck and it did not disappoint. From the plating to the flavors, everything was excellent. I would definitely come back to try their tasting menus every time I am back in Vancouver.
It was our first time here and we ll definitely be back! Everything on the tasting menu was flavourful and delicious! Cocktails were also made well
The best service ever! I didn t get a chance to get the server s name but they were fantastic. All the food was very tasty and good portion as well. I will definitely come back again soon:)
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your feedback, we cannot wait to have you back soon

reviews.review_text: Omakase set menu done right! From start to finish every dish was amazing! Even got to try a couple of extra dishes thanks to a food preference.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hello Leslie, thank you for the 5 star reviews! We are so glad you had a good time and we look forward to having you back anytime!

reviews.review_text: I highly recommend it! One of my favorite places in Vancouver to have really good PAN-ASIAN food! I usually go for the Brussels sprouts and the roasted duck. Everything I have tried is just delicious so you cant go wrong with your order! The service and the service are amazing. The place could have better looks and ambiance though.

We had the pleasure of having our anniversary dinner here. We were amazed with the flavours! The tasting menu is sublime. The cocktails are delicious. The staff are also genuinely friendly Highly recommend:)
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Nic for the kind review, were so glad that you had a good time at Torafuku and we look forward to having you back in the near future!

reviews.review_text: We had the tasting menu and loved it !! Very reasonably priced and great variety and portion sizes. Dessert was to die for. Fish was high quality and delicious. Ambiance cute. Service great.

We had the dine out menu shared among 4 people. Tea and drinks were extra of course. Service is superb, the food is delicious and nicely presented. I wasnt completely full but still satisfied enough. Its slightly on the pricier side but thats to be expected for this type of dining. Overall I enjoyed it.

Honestly food was to die for - ordered the papaya & pork jowl salad, chicken fat rice with foie gras, corn bread and brisket, and three cup chicken. The food came out relatively slow (10-15 minutes between each dish), but worth the wait. Flavour profile was very suitable for my asian palate, and was very filling for a total of ~$100 between 2 people. Three cup chicken is a must order!!

Part of Michelin Guide 2022 and 2023 My my, where do I start with this place!? They had a fire sometime in the summer and are back again. Simple decor, really attentive and active staff. The Chef Tasting Menu is highly recommended. Starters: Mussels (5/5) - Fresh, the miso butter is to die for, I almost licked the plate to the last drop. Bison Tartar (5/5) - melt in the mouth texture, comes with fried wonton wrapper to scoop everything in. Rice crisp are a fun surprise in the texture. Hiramasa Crudo (5/5) - citrusy, Gingery and again melt in your mouth soft texture. I need more than an appy size for this one. Burrata Salad (4/5) - Fresh salad and Burrata. Mains: Black Cod (5/5) The tomato dashi broth can be scooped up with the dinner rolls. Highly recommended wiping the plate clean, fennel adds an extra freshness to the already tasty broth - Cod was well done and soft. Desserts: Magic Stick. (5/5) The Praline leaf was delicately done, milk chocolate mousse and dark chocolate ganache was a good combo! Such intricate cooking and taste combinations is what makes this place amazing. Perfect place for a date night for sure!

Amazing little restaurant by Science World. First, the service was awesome. All of the staff were warm and friendly, service was prompt and thorough. They checked on us multiple times, answered all of our questions with kindess. Ambiant lighting, and the kitchen in full view added to atmosphere. The whole space, including bathrooms were really clean! The unique share plates were a nice touch as well. Came here for Dine Out, and the food was spectacular. Interesting yet tasty takes on asian flavours with a great attention to detail and technique. I liked the white chocolate ganache and the magic mushroom bowl the most, but it was all good! I plan on going back.

Fun Japanese fusion food with a delicious selection for omnivores and vegetarians alike. Loved all the dishes (with the exception of A Wedge-ie because it was a little too smoky for my liking). My favourite was the beef tongue...so perfectly rendered that it practically melts in your mouth. Overall, fantastic food and good service.

It was a little too loud for my liking but overall an amazing experience.  Great drinks and the tasting menu was perfect and I dont like mussels or raw fish/meat.  I ate it all up!!! Very satisfied. Plus, they made our day special with a little unexpected added bonus!  Have your special day there and find out!
Lovely place! Most evenings it s only available by reservation. The food is delicious, we ordered the fixed meal for 2 and it was delicious. Great variety of drinks too.

Delicious fusion food with delightful presentation. Simple interior design. Helpful and polite staffs.  I like the fried potato with duck meat, it is very very tasty. The fish with rice is also impressed me which the rice is added with a little bit coconut makes it really enticing. There is not a ton of choices but everything is extraordinary.

Wow! Recommended by Fairmont Pacific Rim Concierge. As usual, great recommendation! 5 hungry, gourmet food loving adults were pleasantly surprised by the 7-course Omakase Tasting Menu Dinner. $70./person +tax+tip. Appetizers: Bison Tartare, Burrata salad, Mussels were all excellent! Mains: Duck & Black Miso Cod with accompanying starch (Pain au Lait & steamed Bai buns w side of Foie gras) were perfectly done with great taste sensations. Use the bread & Bao bun to dip into the sauce &/or make a wrap! Dessert: Basque Cheesecake was the best.Creme Caramel & Chocolate Ganache were also very good. The ambience was minimalist but comfortable. It could use a bit more  warmth  or  ambience . Service was fantastic & flexible. We finished at 10pm (past their closing time but never felt rushed). It s several blocks away from the downtown East Van so need to be a bit careful not to walk east late at night. Go west! Great gourmand experience !! GO!

One of my favorite Asian fusion cuisine in town. All dishes are so innovatively designed and cooked, and they are super delicious. I particularly like the Petty Wap, the lobster sauce blends in nicely with the fettuccine and seafood. The menu changes from time to time, also the presentation of the dishes. Dont be surprised to see the same dish presented a different way the next time you visit. All in all, a great restaurant to hang out with friends but not so much with family tho :)

Can never go wrong here. We tried the new omakase with the duck set. It was the perfect amount of food, very filling. My favorites were the scallop crudo and the duck rillete. There seemed to be some vietnamese inspiration for this menu (oxtail, nutty salad, coffee tiramisu, pate). Really smart and delicious creations. And of course the staff are always attentive and kind.

The friendly waitstaff was delightful. The food was stellar; light, flavourful, elegantly plated and left you wanting more. We were celebrating our 17th wedding anniversary and the staff at Torafuku made it pleasant and memorable for us. We will definitely return.

The tasting menu was excellent!  From the appetizer to the main course, plus ordering a separate pain au lait to sop up the broth from the mussels, to the basque cheesecake, each plate was delicious!!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your feedback, your comment is important to us and our whole team appreciate your valuable advise.

reviews.review_text: Food was great, server was great and vibe was great too.  The seating was tight at the long table which both my friend and I felt constraint.  We are 6ft and 6ft + tall guys.  The only reason I marked down on the value was because we were debating between omakase special $65/pp and a la carte and realized it s actually cheaper when we order a la carte and get to choose what we want.  End up around $59/pp + tax and tip (5 appy 2 main & shared among 3 of us) and it was filling. Conclusion:  its worth going again, this time I might put our height on the special note for special seating accommodation  . See caption for the food descriptions

Absolutely loved this place. Went there for Experiment Sunday lunch - where we visit a restaurant we have never been to. The food and service are beyond excellent. I ordered the Rice and Noodle bowl with Chicken and Crack salad and thought I was in heaven. Add a nice bottle of wine, which was $10 off due to happy hour and I loved it. The location is in a developing part of town but trust me on this you need to go here.

Creative, fun and yet comforting! There is nothing on their menu that will disappoint you. I am not sure if the menu we were served were stable items seasonal but if you see the duck risotto you MUST try it! It will heal your soul!!! The Thai milk tea panna cotta is one of the best thing Ive tasted in a long time and if you think you have no more room for dessert, go run around the block and come back for it! You cannot end your meal without it!!! The restaurant is known for taking traditional Japanese cousin elevating them with a modern and unexpected twist and this is carried out to their drink menu. The cocktails are fun, delicious and better than many other higher end restaurants. Definitely recommend this place for date night, friends gathering and even if you just drop in for some drinks. They are priced reasonably and its one of those restaurants that you do get enough portions so go with friends and loved ones and have a wonderful amazing time!

Good food. Good service. Good price. Wagyu beef bowl is great. Brussels sprouts is delicious and can be shared. Big appetizer serving Pork belly bowl is a braised pork style but rich in flavor. Will definitely be back.
If there is a restaurant that you will go back for seconds, then this one is it. The short rib and bison tartare are stand outs amongst an great menu.

When you visit Torafuku you ll want to taste as much as possible because it is just that good. Try the tasting menu or go with a group and share plates, as many are design with that in mind. The flavours are rich and interesting, I am already planning my next visit back.

Everything was absolutely delightful! I started with an Emarosa while waiting for my partner, which was a sweet, delicate cocktail that reminded me of the jellies I would devour as a kid - but in a more elevated, elegant version. Absolutely delicious. We then had the beets, the poutine, and the steak. Every single dish was absolutely delectable. The beets were beautifully marinated, and the accompanying mushrooms and garlicky goodness was seriously top-notch and flavour-packed. The poutine (while definitely not a poutine and very deserving of the many question marks on the menu) was an amazing play of textures and rich, delicious duck. The crispy-creamy polenta and the gorgeous gravy was extraordinary, and the fresh pop from the tomatoes kept it from veering into overly heavy. Of all the dishes, definitely the most out there (especially, and I must stress this, if you are expecting any sort of traditional poutine), but also incredibly well-balanced. And finally, the beef. While the rest of the dish was extraordinary, with the two different but equally umptuous radish/turnips and sweet puree and beautifully textured potato (the crust! The soft lovely layers!), the standout was of course the beef. Expertly flavoured and cooked perfectly, yes, and just extremely tender and with a positively luscious mouthfeel .... What an incredible night, what a fantastic meal, and great decor and an intriguing open kitchen, too! Absolutely 100% worth visiting.

My friend and I decided to eat here during the Vancity Pride Fest. Staff were very friendly and the food tasted amazing! The food literally tasted like crack and we had a matcha cocktail drink which was delicious! Definitely recommend coming here and will visit again!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind feedback, we look forward to having you back anytime!

reviews.review_text: Came during Dine Out Vancouver for dinner. I was really blown away by the flavours and presentation here. The sashimi/tataki appetizer we had was really good with the perfect balance of fish, wasabi and citrus. Mains of roasted pork belly was really good with perfect crunchiness and seasoning as well as portion size. I really enjoyed their incorporation of texture into their dishes such as the fried quinoa on top of the appetizer and the puffed corn on top of the mains. 2nd time here: Loved the beef tartare dish! Also loved their cauliflower and brussel sprout dish with chickpeas - probably my favourite dish of the night!. Wagyu beef was not the best, the sides didnt work the best with the meat and the bonito flakes on top sadly masked the true meat flavour  - not worth the price. But the rest was good and would come back to try more of their menu! Especially their drink menu which is really interesting!!

My personal experience in this Asian cousine was superb, the dumplings totally fresh the meat perfect cook. The main dishes pork belly rice and Torafoku beef noodle soup. The first one the rice was amazing the pork mind blowing soft tender and sweet. The second one was new I havent tried before the meat perfect cooked and perfect combination with the sauce. We finish satisfied. about the drinks a fresh citrus mocktial yuzu lemon soda totally a recommendation. A pro tip dont believe what haters wrote, is just not like they said go and try by your self.

Went for the Fall Omakaze. It was excellent. By far the best dish was the Brussels sprouts. Ive never had such a great veg dish in my life. *UPDATE* Went again for the spring tasting menu. It was another amazing dinner. This time, the fois gras was the clear winner, followed by the fingerling potatoes.

We went to Tarafuku for an early fathers day dinner this past weekend, and we had an amazing experience! We selected the classic 5-course meal which was pre-booked and pre-ordered ahead of time. Every single dish was so flavourful, unique, fresh, delicious, and beautiful. The first two of our courses were taking rather long but the server noticed this and as an apology, they gave us an extra appetizer which we were not expecting at all. Not only this, but to reinforce how bad they felt they even gave us an extra dessert course! We were completely stuffed after but everything was so so yummy and we were so appreciative of their nice gestures to apologize for the long wait time. We also ordered one of their sake cocktails (and a glass of wine) which were great. Overall we completely enjoyed our meal and our experience here and would 100% recommend it to anyone looking for amazing asian-fusion!
Food was great! Atmosphere is spot on!! The waiters were very friendly too. Must go back! Way to go Torafuku!! Food

Amazing food. Cocktail: I couldn t decide what to drink as always.  I told the server that I let the bartender decide, just something refreshing.  Super delicious. Food: Magic Mushroom.  Very well balanced.  The Korean rice cake was done perfectly.  Not too hard, not too sticky.

You gotta eat lunch here if you re gluten-free. OMG, the bowl #5 is to die for!!! Fried (yes FRIED!!) chicken on crack salad and rice with a perfectly poached egg?! Drool. The staff is wonderful, the drinks are fun and the food is heavenly.

First time eating here and without a doubt I can say it is the best food I have eaten in all of Vancouver. I have eaten at numerous michelin star restaurants in New York, but I can say Torafuku is definitely the best dining experience I have had to date. I had the chicken wings, the duck breast (absolute favorite) , Wagyu steak and the pumpkin spice dessert. Everything was absolutely amazing. Will definitely come back. I could eat here every day!
Wide interior, comfy , super nice staffs, great places Only   in China Town Recommended dishes

Terrific meal and experience at Torafuku last night. Shared 4 dishes: roasted brussel sprouts, sablefish collar, duck fried rice and the beef tataki. All were delicious but the first 3 were the most memorable. Great service that spaced out the dishes so we could enjoy each one. Filled up after we arrived but the noise levels still allowed for normal conversation. Looked like they had some interesting cocktails but I opted for a craft beer from a good selection.
Tried their signature beef noodle. Tasty. Sad to say this restaurant is located in a spotty area. Hope the new mayor can really do sth about it.

It was GREAT! The rice bols were filled and left us full. The chicken and pork was tender and everything was tasty! It s prices were reasonable for the quality and quantity. Service was kind and I would come back any day.
Impressive anniversary omakase. Service was great and the highlight was definitely the scallop crudo, roast duck and foie gras jam and the cornbread dessert. Would recommend!

Pricey for a food court, but like Wow Thai across the court, you shouldnt be thinking of the place as a mall food court as the food is seriously well prepared here.   The broth is a fatty boiled concoction if goodness and richness with flavors of broth, salt rolling over your tongue, while the noodles are chewy without being rubber
Great fusion restaurant! The flavour combinations are exceptional! Their desserts are licking good. I wish i can to-go some~

so so satisfied to have this bowl of Taiwanese braised beef noodles on a rainy day. Their beef is braised 72 hours and the noodles are hand pulled. Remember that Ive said that Im very picky with my noodles? Well these are pretty darn good. The noodles are chewy and the beef shank melts in your mouth   . Im also pretty positive that theres no msg in the soup. My Taiwanese friend who went with me also approved of the authenticity! The bun me was also very good ! . price: $20 taste: atmosphere: seating: Price Performance ratio:

They started opening for lunch in 2019.  I had a rice bowl for lunch, it was delicious.  The chicken + pork is their most popular bowl.  The thinly sliced pork belly is so addictive.  Breaded chicken was tender and juicy, drizzled with sauce.  The poached egg mixed perfectly with the kickass rice. It felt like a fusion of rice bowls from different cultures.  Lunch prices are reasonable.  Quick friendly service.
Really great cocktail menu. Sours, booze-forward, sweet & spiced options all with an Asian twist. Looking forward to trying the food next time!
Visited during Dine Out Vancouver and their tasting menu did not disappoint! A contemporary twist on classic east asian flavours, the quality and presentation of the food was exceptional.

Stopped by during the lunch time and was really surprised how delicious their Awesomeness in a bowl is. I got the half & half one with pork and chicken. Its so delicious that Torafuku is on the list of my favorite lunch places since! Loved the space, music and customer service as well. What a discovery! Wish they had WiFi
Enjoyed Torafuku with our great friends.  The 7 course dinner was delicious.

Le Tigre food truck takes over The Torafuku during lunch and serves a limited, but delicious, menu - mainly rice bowls.  Their famous crack are deep fried vegetables that are a must try.  They go well with both the chicken or pork rice bowl.  I ve been here multiple times and each time, the ingredients are fresh and the taste is very consistent.  Service is amazing.  Prices are fair too at $12 to $15 a bowl.
Great tasting menu at a great price, awesome service and experience overall
Amazing food and wonderful people. We had the  7 courses Omakase which was delicious. Totally recommend it.
Had a small birthday celebration for my friend here. The beef short ribs were so tender. Thank you!
Absolutely delicious food and friendly service. Very unique flavours. This restaurant totally blew me away.
I am always amazed by the quality of the food. Quality in taste, creativity and ingredients. Everyone there is friendly and I guarantee you will always have grade A customer service.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the lovely feedback, we really appreciate your support!

reviews.review_text: Lovely place! Most evenings it s only available by reservation. The food is delicious, we ordered the fixed meal for 2 and it was delicious. Great variety of drinks too.

Food was delicious and portion sizes were good. The servers were all very nice and gave good recommendations as well. $65 per person for the 7 course is a bit pricey but it was worth it for how good the food was.
I love their beef noodle soup, its one of my favorite dishes.
Great ambience, food, and service. Rice bowls and salads are very heavy. Tastes great, but could do with a bit less oil. Egg was so good, I almost cried
Stuffed after the 10 course omakase.  Their drinks are awesome too and they had $2 off cocktails until 7.

Two of us dined here last night and ordered the tasting menu. We choose the beef short rib and the cheesecake. The tasting menu is an excellent value. The 7 courses were all delicious and portions were decent. I couldnt believe how big the cheesecake was (probably can share with 4 people). The restaurant was full and there were only 2 servers - they did a good job and were very friendly. Highly recommended.
This was one of the most delicious Taiwanese Food I have ever tried,    i hardly recommend,   you wont be sorry if you ever visit this place,  I loved every bite of what I ordered
Everything was delicious! Definitely one of the best in Vancouver
Great food and incredible cocktails! Staff was super friendly and helpful. Portion sizes were larger than expected, which was a bonus.

Torafuku is an exceptional dining experience. I want to highlight their bartender first. My partner and I were not going to order any drinks when we went until we saw how interesting and delicious they sounded. We ordered the O my Sake, and it was the best sake cocktail i have ever had. It also looked beautiful, truly a great experience for all senses. The Roasted Beets and Kanpachi Crudo were easily the best dishes we had. Im not sure how they made walnuts taste fluffy, but it was phenomenal. The sauce used for the Kanpachi Crudo was perfect, smokey and buttery, full of umami. Although the service could have been better, this is the perfect restaurant is you want high class food in a small, intimate setting. Vegetarian options: They have some great veggie options available.

A friend and I came here for lunch today(1st time). My friend got the pork belly bowl and I got the crispy chicken bowl; we were both very pleased with our choices. The prices were reasonable and the customer service was very good as well! Will be back sometime in the future :).
Pork belly and fried chicken bowl. Comes with a poached egg and thinly chopped cabbage. Very good
Good food, reasonable price. Simple menu and parking available nearby. Check it out on a nice day w/ some friends!
Was pleasantly surprised on how good the food was.  We ordered a bunch of different small plates to share and enjoyed every single dish.

We went in for a quick lunch on a late Sunday afternoon (2pm ish) and the restaurant was quite busy! I ordered a Taiwanese beef noodle soup and it is possibly the best Taiwanese beef noodle soup I have ever had (as a Taiwanese myself, I have had quite a bit fair share of beef noodle soup). My partner had chicken and crack salad rice. That was pretty good as well. Certainly highly recommend and will come back for dinner another day for sure.

I was here for dine out and it was a 10/10 experience. Great service, and the food was just awesome! Excellent combinations of flavours and textures. The salad was creative and tasty, and the steak came in a perfectly cooked and very generous portion. Loved it!

Wow! What an amazing selection. We had the 7 course taster menu and it was excellent from start to finish. The small portions were just right. We were worried that it wasnt going to be enough but the main and dessert was perfect. Tasty and just really well done with excellent service. We also tried some of the cocktails and they were delicious. Cant wait to try another tasting menu!
Great Asian fusion food at very reasonable prices, and a very strong cocktail game.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hello Ian, thank you for the kind words and 5 star review! We look forward to having you back anytime :) If you like our cocktails, consider visit us WED-SUN before 5:30PM to enjoy the cocktails at happy hour prices!

reviews.review_text: Such great flavours, amazing food and cocktails. My wife and I have been here several times and we love it every time. For the high quality of the food, the prices are very reasonable. There s always something new on the menu and they re not afraid to try doing something different, talented Chefs here that s for sure. Try the whole fish, oh so good.

Really loved our visit here. We had the set menu for their restaurant anniversary and everything was great. Dishes are a good size. The yuzu cheesecake and cucumber cocktail were standouts. Thank you also for the great service :)
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you, your feedback is important to us, thank you for visiting Torafuku.

reviews.review_text: One of the best beef noodles in Vancouver!
Always great food with unique recipes. Both dine in and take out are great. Highly recommend the brussel sprout salad and the roast duck, but everything is excellent.

Erica and the other server were super kind and sweet. We had an amazing time tasting the inventive dishes!!! The steelhead trout with curry had flavours that exploded in your mouth and we tried potato salad with ikura for the first time. Drinks were tasty too! Everything was amazing and we will definitely be back soon!!!
No fan of infusion  food but Torafuku food is excellent.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind review, we will try our best to keep up the good work

reviews.review_text: Great food and service. Dishes showed lots of creativity and blend very well together in taste and presentation. You can see that it was very busy because of the open kitchen design but the staff team were very professional and organized. Compliments to the chef!
Great innovative dishes and yummy cocktails.

As a gift to new parents this week, I ordered 3 family meals and some frozen vegetarian dumplings from the Torafuku@Home menu. The delivery option was fantastic and convenient. From the feedback I received, the recipients indicated the food was delicious (fresh). They were impressed with the great combination of items within the meals, and the meals were efficiently packaged for finishing at home. Great value. Overall, the recipients were grateful that they were able to enjoy such delicious food at home from Torafuku during their first week as parents. Thank you for stepping out of the box and being creative and resourceful during this time of the pandemic. You prove that you are masters of the comeback.
A hidden gem on Main Street! The rice bowls are packed with flavour and really good meat sizes. Must try the braised beef noodle soup, it is worth it!!

The food quality and taste is, and always has been, incredible at torafuku. 5 years of eating here I can t believe it took me this long to write a review. Rice bowls are so good and the protein portions are always generous. Crack salad is always crack, the chicken is so good too.  I ve never had a non-amazing food item at torafuku.

An up and coming restaurant right outside of Chinatown! If you are not use to the area at night as it can be kind of sketchy, dont worry, theres a police station several blocks down :) It is tricky to find at first as there is no big sign displaying their awesomeness :) Once you find them, youll notice a more casual, unique Izakaya experience with a great ambiance, fantastic tapas style fusion and friendly service. All the food on the menu is good, however I recommend trying their flavoured sake and magic stick for dessert!! *spoiler alert - the servers come out singing :)
We had the Anniversary 7th course meal with drinks pairing. It was probably the best meal we ve ever had! Everything tasted delicious from the meals to every single drink. 5 stars!

It was our first time here because our friend gifted us a meal. We were blown away by the food, especially the kickass rice! The owner was super nice and genuine and came to ask if I was helped even when someone already helped me. Would come back again and dine in when 2020 is over :) Meanwhile, we found a new place to have takeouts!
Loved it. The menu has changed since I was there last.  It was still fantastic.
